Description: Ostracon (?), large section of the shoulder-section of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, with base of one handle surviving, is covered with a brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink, which is partially obscured by a patch of a black resinous material.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394682) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394682)
